articles.author: Andrew Mills, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israel delayed approval of a deal with Palestinian militant group Hamas for a ceasefire in the Gaza Strip and release of hostages, but the United States said it still expected the agreement to go into effect on Sunday as planned.
articles.title: Israel holds off approving Gaza ceasefire but US says deal is on track

articles.author: Andy Sullivan
articles.description: Trump faces fewer guardrails as he pursues a norm-shattering agenda that is already upending Washington and unsettling the world.
articles.title: Once an interloper, Trump returns to White House more powerful than before

articles.author: Ju-Min Park, Hyunsu Yim, John Geddie
articles.description: As 3,000 riot police swarmed his hillside villa on Wednesday, South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol huddled with party loyalists, telling them that people were increasingly realising the country's legal system had been hijacked by leftist forces.
articles.title: 'It starts now': South Korea's President Yoon defiant as police closed in

articles.author: Dan Peleschuk, Max Hunder
articles.description: Many Ukrainians have scant faith in Donald Trump's promises to swiftly strike a peace deal after he enters the White House on Monday.
articles.title: Trump the saviour? Anxious Ukrainians question president's power to end war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Pakistani court sentenced former Prime Minister Imran Khan to 14 years imprisonment on Friday in a land corruption case, local broadcaster ARY News reported.
articles.title: Pakistan court sentences ex-PM Imran Khan to 14 years in land graft case, ARY News reports

articles.author: Andrew Chung, John Kruzel
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court upheld on Friday a law banning TikTok in the United States on national security grounds if its Chinese parent company ByteDance does not sell the short-video app by Sunday, as the justices in a 9-0 decision declined to rescue a platform used by about half of all Americans.
articles.title: US Supreme Court upholds law banning TikTok

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Joe Biden, who leaves office next week, announced on Friday that he was commuting the sentences of nearly 2,500 people convicted of non-violent drug offenses, saying he has now issued more individual pardons and commutations than any predecessor.
articles.title: Biden commutes more sentences, this time for 2,500 non-violent drug offenders

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: International Criminal Court (ICC) Prosecutor Karim Khan held discussions on Friday with Syrian authorities on how the war crimes tribunal could help in their efforts to prosecute crimes allegedly committed in the country, his office said.
articles.title: ICC prosecutor holds talks on supporting Syria on war crimes prosecution

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former Canadian finance minister Chrystia Freeland on Friday announced that she would take part in the contest to replace Prime Minister Justin Trudeau as leader of the ruling Liberal Party.
articles.title: Former Canada finance minister Freeland running to replace Trudeau

articles.author: Greg Bensinger
articles.description: TikTok is entering its final hours in the U.S. ahead of a potential ban effective on Sunday, prompting howls of protest from devoted users of the beloved video-streaming app.
articles.title: TikTok addicts see silver lining in US ban
